newsitem.title: USA: Ford, Citicorp to scrap rebate program.
newsitem.headline: Ford, Citicorp to scrap rebate program.

text.p: Ford Motor Co and Citicorp said that as of January 1, 1998, Ford Citibank cardmembers will no longer earn Ford rebates on purchases made using the cards.

Cardmembers will continue to earn rebates for all purchases made using the cards through December 31, 1997 and will have five years from the end of the year in which the rebates were earned to redeem them towards a qualifying Ford, Lincoln, Mercury or Jaguar vehicle as long as they continue to be Citibank cardmembers in good standing.
Cardmembers will be notified directly about the changes made to the program, the companies said in a joint statement issued Monday.
Cardmembers can continue to use their Citibank cards after January 1, 1998.

Citing industry analysts, the Wall Street Journal said the credit card rebates may be too generous. Ford's potential liability could top $4 billion if all six million cardholders redeemed their rebate dollars, the paper said.
Company representatives were not immediately available for comment.
